meanings.definition: The state of being drunk or intoxicated.
meanings.sent1: After drinking too much, his insobriety was evident to everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: Her insobriety led to some embarrassing moments at the office party.
meanings.sent3: The insobriety of the squirrel after eating fermented fruit was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The insobriety of the storm clouds foretold a night of heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The insobriety of the toddler after consuming too much apple juice was both amusing and concerning.

meanings.sent1: His insobriety in handling the situation caused more harm than good.
meanings.sent2: The insobriety of his actions led to a series of unfortunate events.
meanings.sent3: The insobriety of the cat chasing its own tail provided some comic relief.
meanings.sent4: The insobriety of her emotions made it difficult for her to make rational decisions.
meanings.sent5: The insobriety of the student's behavior in class disrupted the entire lesson.
